member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Cores.CreateCommand
member.summary: Creates a new core based on preexisting instanceDir/solrconfig.xml/schema.xml, and registers it. If persistence is enabled (persist=true), the configuration for this new core will be saved in 'solr.xml'. If a core with the same name exists, while the "new" created core is initalizing, the "old" one will continue to accept requests. Once it has finished, all new request will go to the "new" core, and the "old" core will be unloaded.

member.summary: This parameter can be used to specify a query that can be used to restrict the super set of documents that can be returned, without influencing score. It can be very useful for speeding up complex queries since the queries specified with fq are cached independently from the main query. This assumes the same Filter is used again for a latter query (i.e. there's a cache hit)

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.Algorithms
member.summary:
Clustering algorithms. See details in:
http://project.carrot2.org/algorithms.html http://download.carrot2.org/stable/manual/#section.advanced-topics.fine-tuning.choosing-algorithm

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.Algorithms.Lingo
member.summary: Diversity: High , many small (outlier) clusters highlighted. Labels: Longer, often more descriptive. Scalability: Low. For more than about 1000 documents, Lingo clustering will take a long time and large memory

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.Algorithms.STC
member.summary: Diversity: Low, small (outlier) clusters rarely highlighted. Labels: Shorter, but still appropriate. Scalability: High

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.Algorithms.KMeans
member.summary: Diversity: Low, small (outlier) clusters rarely highlighted. Labels: One-word only, may not always describe all documents in the cluster. Scalability: Low, based on similar data structures as Lingo.

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag
member.summary: Constants for the choices of Regex Flags

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: By default, case-insensitive matching assumes that only characters in the US-ASCII charset are being matched. Unicode-aware case-insensitive matching can be enabled by specifying the flag in conjunction with this flag.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.Comments
member.summary: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.MultiLine
member.summary: In multiline mode the expressions ^ and $ match just after or just before, respectively, a line terminator or the end of the input sequence. By default these expressions only match at the beginning and the end of the entire input sequence.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.Literal
member.summary: When this flag is specified then the input string that specifies the pattern is treated as a sequence of literal characters. Metacharacters or escape sequences in the input sequence will be given no special meaning. The flags CASE_INSENSITIVE and UNICODE_CASE retain their impact on matching when used in conjunction with this flag. The other flags become superfluous.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.DotAll
member.summary: In dotall mode, the expression . matches any character, including a line terminator. By default this expression does not match line terminators.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.UnicodeCase
member.summary: When this flag is specified then case-insensitive matching, when enabled by the CASE_INSENSITIVE flag, is done in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. By default, case-insensitive matching assumes that only characters in the US-ASCII charset are being matched.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.CanonEq
member.summary: When this flag is specified then two characters will be considered to match if, and only if, their full canonical decompositions match. The expression "a\u030A", for example, will match the string "å" when this flag is specified. By default, matching does not take canonical equivalence into account.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.RegexFlag.UnixLines
member.summary: In this mode, only the '\n' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of ., ^, and $.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Fields
member.summary: The name of the field to get the terms from. Required. (terms.fl)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Lower
member.summary: Lower bound term to start at. Optional. If not specified, the empty string is used, meaning start at the beginning of the field. (terms.lower)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.LowerInclude
member.summary: Include the lower bound term in the result set. Default is true. (terms.lower.incl)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Upper
member.summary: The term to stop at. Either upper or terms.limit must be set. (terms.upper)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.UpperInclude
member.summary: Include the upper bound term in the result set. Default is false. (terms.upper.incl)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.MinCount
member.summary: The minimum doc frequency to return in order to be included. Results are inclusive of the mincount (i.e. >= mincount) (terms.mincount)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.MaxCount
member.summary: The maximum doc frequency. Default is -1 to have no upper bound. Results are inclusive of the maxcount (i.e. less than maxcount) (terms.maxcount)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Prefix
member.summary: Restrict matches to terms that start with the prefix. Optional. Use this for implementing AutoComplete! (terms.prefix)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Regex
member.summary: Restrict matches to terms that match the regular expression. Optional. Requires Solr 3.1+ (terms.regex)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.RegexFlag
member.summary: Flags to be used when evaluating the regular expression defined in the "terms.regex" parameter (see http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html#compile%28java.lang.String,%20int%29 for more details). This parameter can be defined multiple times (each time with different flag). Requires Solr 3.1+ (terms.regex.flag)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Limit
member.summary: The maximum number of terms to return. The default is 10. If less than 0, then include all terms. (terms.limit)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Raw
member.summary: If true, return the raw characters of the indexed term, regardless of if it is human readable. For instance, the indexed form of numeric numbers is not human readable. The default is false. (terms.raw)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.TermsParameters.Sort
member.summary: If count, sorts the terms by the term frequency (highest count first). If index, returns the terms in index order. Default is to sort by count. (terms.sort)

member.name: P:SolrNet.ExtractParameters.Capture
member.summary:
Tika XHTML NAME: Capture XHTML elements with the name separately for adding to the Solr document. This can be useful for grabbing chunks of the XHTML into a separate field. For instance, it could be used to grab paragraphs (

) and index them into a separate field.
member.remarks: Content is also still captured into the overall "content" field.

member.summary: Collection of facet queries

member.summary: Limits the terms on which to facet to those starting with the given string prefix.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Sort
member.summary: Set to true, this parameter indicates that constraints should be sorted by their count. If false, facets will be in their natural index order (unicode). For terms in the ascii range, this will be alphabetically sorted. The default is true if Limit is greater than 0, false otherwise.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Limit
member.summary: This param indicates the maximum number of constraint counts that should be returned for the facet fields. A negative value means unlimited. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Offset
member.summary: This param indicates an offset into the list of constraints to allow paging. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.MinCount
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum counts for facet fields should be included in the response. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.Missing
member.summary: Set to true this param indicates that in addition to the Term based constraints of a facet field, a count of all matching results which have no value for the field should be computed Default is false

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.FacetParameters.EnumCacheMinDf
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum document frequency (number of documents matching a term) for which the filterCache should be used when determining the constraint count for that term. This is only used during the term enumeration method of faceting (field type faceting on multi-valued or full-text fields). A value greater than zero will decrease memory usage of the filterCache, but increase the query time. When faceting on a field with a very large number of terms, and you wish to decrease memory usage, try a low value of 25 to 50 first. The default value is 0, causing the filterCache to be used for all terms in the field.

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters
member.summary: Spell checking parameters

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Query
member.summary: The query to spellcheck. If spellcheck.q is defined, then it is used, otherwise the original input query is used. The spellcheck.q parameter is intended to be the original query, minus any extra markup like field names, boosts, etc. If the q parameter is specified, then the SpellingQueryConverter class is used to parse it into tokens, otherwise the WhitesepaceTokenizer is used. The choice of which one to use is up to the application. Essentially, if you have a spelling "ready" version in your application, then it is probably better to send spellcheck.q, otherwise, if you just want Solr to do the job, use the q parameter

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SpellCheckingParameters.Build
member.summary: Create the dictionary for use by the SolrSpellChecker. In typical applications, one needs to build the dictionary before using it. However, it may not always be necessary as it is possible to setup the spellchecker with a dictionary that already exists.

member.summary: The maximum number of suggestions to return

member.summary: Manages Solr cores.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Alias(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The ALIAS action establishes an additional name by which a core may be referenced. Subsequent actions may use the core's original name or any of its aliases.
member.remarks: This action is still considered experimental.
member.param: The name or alias of an existing core.
The additional name by which this core should be known.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Create(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The CREATE action creates a new core and registers it. If persistence is enabled (persistent="true" on the <solr> element), the updated configuration for this new core will be saved in solr.xml. If a core with the given name already exists, it will continue to handle requests while the new core is initializing. When the new core is ready, it will take new requests and the old core will be unloaded.
member.param: The name of the new core. Same as "name" on the <core> element.
The directory where files for this core should be stored. Same as "instanceDir" on the <core> element.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The CREATE action creates a new core and registers it. If persistence is enabled (persistent="true" on the <solr> element), the updated configuration for this new core will be saved in solr.xml. If a core with the given name already exists, it will continue to handle requests while the new core is initializing. When the new core is ready, it will take new requests and the old core will be unloaded.
member.param: The name of the new core. Same as "name" on the <core> element.
The directory where files for this core should be stored. Same as "instanceDir" on the <core> element.
(Optional) Name of the config file (solrconfig.xml) relative to "instanceDir".
(Optional) Name of the schema file (schema.xml) relative to "instanceDir".
(Optional) Name of the data directory relative to "instanceDir".

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Reload(System.String)
member.summary: The RELOAD action loads a new core from the configuration of an existing, registered core. While the new core is initializing, the existing one will continue to handle requests. When the new core is ready, it takes over and the old core is unloaded. This is useful when you've made changes to a core's configuration on disk, such as adding new field definitions. Calling the RELOAD action lets you apply the new configuration without having to restart the Web container.
member.param: The name of the core to be reloaded.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The RENAME action changes the name of a core.
member.param: The name of the core to be renamed.
The new name for the core. If the persistent attribute of <solr> is "true", the new name will be written to solr.xml as the "name" attribute of the <core> attribute.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Status

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Status(System.String)

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Swap(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: SWAP atomically swaps the names used to access two existing cores. This can be used to swap new content into production. The prior core remains available and can be swapped back, if necessary. Each core will be known by the name of the other, after the swap.
member.param: The name of one of the cores to be swapped.
The name of one of the cores to be swapped.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Unload(System.String)
member.summary: The UNLOAD action removes a core from Solr. Active requests will continue to be processed, but no new requests will be sent to the named core. If a core is registered under more than one name, only the given name is removed.
member.param: The name of the core to be to be removed. If the persistent attribute of <solr> is set to "true", the <core> element with this "name" attribute will be removed from solr.xml.

member.name: M:SolrNet.ISolrCoreAdmin.Unload(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The CREATE action creates a new core and registers it. If persistence is enabled (persistent="true" on the <solr> element), the updated configuration for this new core will be saved in solr.xml. If a core with the given name already exists, it will continue to handle requests while the new core is initializing. When the new core is ready, it will take new requests and the old core will be unloaded.
member.param: The name of the new core. Same as "name" on the <core> element.
The directory where files for this SolrCore should be stored. Same as "instanceDir" on the <core> element.
(Optional) Name of the config file (solrconfig.xml) relative to "instanceDir".
(Optional) Name of the schema file (schema.xml) relative to "instanceDir".
(Optional) Name of the data directory relative to "instanceDir".

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Reload(System.String)
member.summary: The RELOAD action loads a new core from the configuration of an existing, registered core. While the new core is initializing, the existing one will continue to handle requests. When the new core is ready, it takes over and the old core is unloaded. This is useful when you've made changes to a core's configuration on disk, such as adding new field definitions. Calling the RELOAD action lets you apply the new configuration without having to restart the Web container.
member.param: The name of the core to be reloaded.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The RENAME action changes the name of a core.
member.param: The name of the core to be renamed.
The new name for the core. If the persistent attribute of <solr> is "true", the new name will be written to solr.xml as the "name" attribute of the <core> attribute.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Status
member.summary: The STATUS action returns the status of all running cores.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Status(System.String)
member.summary: The STATUS action returns the status of the named core.
member.param: The name of a core, as listed in the "name" attribute of a <core> element in solr.xml.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Swap(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: SWAP atomically swaps the names used to access two existing cores. This can be used to swap new content into production. The prior core remains available and can be swapped back, if necessary. Each core will be known by the name of the other, after the swap.
member.param: The name of one of the cores to be swapped.
The name of one of the cores to be swapped.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Unload(System.String)
member.summary: The UNLOAD action removes a core from Solr. Active requests will continue to be processed, but no new requests will be sent to the named core. If a core is registered under more than one name, only the given name is removed.
member.param: The name of the core to be to be removed. If the persistent attribute of <solr> is set to "true", the <core> element with this "name" attribute will be removed from solr.xml.

member.name: M:SolrNet.Impl.SolrCoreAdmin.Unload(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The UNLOAD action removes a core from Solr. Active requests will continue to be processed, but no new requests will be sent to the named core. If a core is registered under more than one name, only the given name is removed.
member.param: The name of the core to be to be removed. If the persistent attribute of <solr> is set to "true", the <core> element with this "name" attribute will be removed from solr.xml.

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters
member.summary: Highlighting parameters

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Fields
member.summary: List of fields to generate highlighted snippets for. If left blank, the fields highlighted for the StandardRequestHandler are the defaultSearchField (or the df param if used) and for the DisMaxRequestHandler the qf fields are used.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Snippets
member.summary: The maximum number of highlighted snippets to generate per field. It is possible for any number of snippets from zero to this value to be generated. If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (1 for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Fragsize
member.summary: The size, in characters, of fragments to consider for highlighting. 0 indicates that the whole field value should be used (no fragmenting). If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (100 for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RequireFieldMatch
member.summary: If true, then a field will only be highlighted if the query matched in this particular field (normally, terms are highlighted in all requested fields regardless of which field matched the query). If left null, it will use whatever default Solr sets (false for Solr 1.3)

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.AlternateField
member.summary: If a snippet cannot be generated (due to no terms matching), you can specify a field to use as the backup/default summary. The default value is to not have a default summary.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.BeforeTerm
member.summary: The text which appears before a highlighted term. The default value is "<em>"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.AfterTerm
member.summary: The text which appears after a highlighted term. The default value is ""

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexSlop
member.summary: Factor by which the regex fragmenter can stray from the ideal fragment size (given by hl.fragsize) to accomodate the regular expression. For instance, a slop of 0.2 with fragsize of 100 should yield fragments between 80 and 120 characters in length. It is usually good to provide a slightly smaller fragsize when using the regex fragmenter. The default value is ".6"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexPattern
member.summary: The regular expression for fragmenting. This could be used to extract sentences

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.RegexMaxAnalyzedChars
member.summary: Only analyze this many characters from a field when using the regex fragmenter (after which, the fragmenter produces fixed-sized fragments). Applying a complicated regex to a huge field is expensive. The default value is "10000".

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.MergeContiguous
member.summary: Collapse contiguous fragments into a single fragment. "true" indicates contiguous fragments will be collapsed into single fragment. This parameter makes sense for Highlighter only. The default value is "false", which is also the backward-compatible setting.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.UsePhraseHighlighter
member.summary: Use SpanScorer to highlight phrase terms only when they appear within the query phrase in the document. Default value is "false".

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.UseFastVectorHighlighter
member.summary: Uses FastVectorHighlighter (Solr 3.1+). FastVectorHighlighter requires the field is termVectors=on, termPositions=on and termOffsets=on. The default value is "false"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.HighlightMultiTerm
member.summary: If the SpanScorer is also being used, enables highlighting for range/wildcard/fuzzy/prefix queries. This parameter makes sense for Highlighter only. The default is "false"

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.MaxAnalyzedChars
member.summary: How many characters into a document to look for suitable snippets. This parameter makes sense for Highlighter only. The default value is "51200".

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.MaxAlternateFieldLength
member.summary: If hl.alternateField is specified, this parameter specifies the maximum number of characters of the field to return. Any value less than or equal to 0 means unlimited. The default value is unlimited.

member.name: P:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.HighlightingParameters.Fragmenter
member.summary: Specify a text snippet generator for highlighted text. This parameter makes sense for Highlighter only. The default value is "gap".

member.name: T:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SolrHighlightFragmenter
member.summary: Different types of fragmenter used when highlighting.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SolrHighlightFragmenter.Gap
member.summary: Creates fixed-sized fragments with gaps for multi-valued fields.

member.name: F:SolrNet.Commands.Parameters.SolrHighlightFragmenter.Regex
member.summary: Create fragments that "look like" a certain regular expression.

member.name: T:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery
member.summary: Date facet query

member.name: M:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery.#ctor(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a date facet query
member.param: The lower bound for the first date range for all Date Faceting on this field
The minimum upper bound for the last date range for all Date Faceting on this field
The size of each date range expressed as an interval to be added to the lower bound using the DateMathParser syntax.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery.HardEnd
member.summary: What to do in the event that the gap does not divide evenly between start and end. If this is true, the last date range constraint will have an upper bound of end; if false, the last date range will have the smallest possible upper bound greater then end such that the range is exactly gap wide. The default is false.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetDateQuery.Other
member.summary: Indicates that in addition to the counts for each date range constraint between start and end, counts should also be computed for other

member.name: T:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery
member.summary: Facet field query

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Field
member.summary: Facet field

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Prefix
member.summary: Limits the terms on which to facet to those starting with the given string prefix.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Sort
member.summary: Set to true, this parameter indicates that constraints should be sorted by their count. If false, facets will be in their natural index order (unicode). For terms in the ascii range, this will be alphabetically sorted. The default is true if Limit is greater than 0, false otherwise.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Limit
member.summary: This param indicates the maximum number of constraint counts that should be returned for the facet fields. A negative value means unlimited. The default value is 100.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Offset
member.summary: This param indicates an offset into the list of constraints to allow paging. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.MinCount
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum counts for facet fields should be included in the response. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.Missing
member.summary: Set to true this param indicates that in addition to the Term based constraints of a facet field, a count of all matching results which have no value for the field should be computed Default is false

member.name: P:SolrNet.SolrFacetFieldQuery.EnumCacheMinDf
member.summary: This param indicates the minimum document frequency (number of documents matching a term) for which the filterCache should be used when determining the constraint count for that term. This is only used during the term enumeration method of faceting (field type faceting on multi-valued or full-text fields). A value greater than zero will decrease memory usage of the filterCache, but increase the query time. When faceting on a field with a very large number of terms, and you wish to decrease memory usage, try a low value of 25 to 50 first. The default value is 0, causing the filterCache to be used for all terms in the field.
